chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L Uhe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.  Must submit DNA sample.

Any general counseling as recommended by agent,   
No unsupervised contact w/females under 18 - agent can formulate,  
Must comply w/Sex Offender Registry,  
Can use technology @ work place (i.e. internet, smart phone) for work purposes,  
Agent can review/control devices and emails for personal use.

timeConds.notes: Huber granted.  Can transfer closer to work (Waupaca or Outagamie).   Credit of 4 days per jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: to DE of Penalties
DNA proof of submission-signed by DE

Defendant Jason L Uhe in court with attorney Nila Robinson.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Robinson makes factual corrections to PSI.  JM sworn & testifies (character witness for DE).  Atty Robinson apologizes for letters forwarded to the Court from email w/o signatures.  Court will allow Atty R. to fax email cover sheets to the Court this afternoon and reads letters in question.  DA Parker - argues/cites case history, reviews Dr. Cummings' report, makes recommendation - 5 yrs probation, 1 yr jail, fine/costs and conditions.    Atty Robinson - argues,  requests 3 years probation Court allow DE to use Internet for work  purposes, relax smart phone issue, minimal jail time.  DE addresses the Court, apologizes to the Court.  Court questions DE, reminds DE of Voting & Firearms rights.  Court orders 3 yrs probation w/h sentence, $500 fine plus costs, DNA sample and $250 surcharge, 6 mo jail w/Huber, no unsupervised contact w/females under 18, must comply w/sex offender registry, can only access Internet for work purposes, agent can control home devices.  Appeal rights given to DE.
6 Letters of Support for DE (cover emails added 4-17-17)
letter from Attorney Robinson requesting adjournment
Sentencing hearing on April 14, 2017 at 10:15 am.

Report of Dr. Cummings
Sentencing hearing on March 7, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jason L Uhe in court with attorney Nila Robinson.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PLQ filed w/NC plea to amended charge.  ADA Niemi to file amended information.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE.  10:12-10:37 am  Atty Robinson & DE leave courtroom to discuss issue.  Court continues to explaination of rights w/DE.  DE enters plea.  Court accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended charge. Atty Robinson provides Court w/copy of Dr. Cummings' report.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on January 4, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Nila Robinson in court by phone.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Robinson-  discussions have been held w/DA Parker re: evaluation of DE.  DA Parker - offer was sent Feb. 9, 2016, feels a plea hearing can be scheduled w/i 90 days.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Attny Robinson is requesting the jury trial be taken off for 9/27/16.  An evaluation is to be performed and should be available about 45 days out.  Would like to be set for a status with enough time for possibly entering a plea.  Court will take jury trial off the calendar.
